item.title: Report I-2025010085
item.description:
Report I-2025010085

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-01T00:52:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-07
  • City: Port Allen
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 01/06/2025 trailer 286454L arrived into BTR from MOB at 23:11 containing the 3 drum shipment on pro# 408307927. The trailer was set up for stripping at 23:30. On 01/07/2025 at 00:42, the shipment was moved& scanned to trailer 400195, located in door 25, by employee 53441. Approximately at 01:30 on 01/07/2025 trailer 400195 was being stripped for the Inbound operation. The employee stripping the trailer could smell the very strong odor of the chemical in the trailer. It was determined that one of the three drums had a fork hole in it& was Leaking. Safety was contacted& the proper channels were contacted from there. Louisiana State Police arrived on site& the in house clean up was performed. All items will be disposed of accordingly. After reviewing the cameras, considering the chemical is very thick& did not leave a trail. It was not determined if the order came into BTR Leaking. If the order was punctured during the initial off-loading of 286454L, or if the drum was punctured while off-loading 400195.
